source_objects.title: Project Management
source_objects.description: Master Project Management with courses on: PMI RMP, PRINCE Foundation certification, software project management, CBAP, project planning and execution.

items.title: Mastering Agile Scrum Project Management

visible_instructors.name: LearnSmart
visible_instructors.job_title: Smarter Training. Never Open a Textbook.
visible_instructors.title: LearnSmart LLC

items.headline: Review and master agile development & scrum methodologies for your career.
objectives_summary: Review an introduction to Agile, Principles, Change Management, Prioritization, Stakeholder Expectations, Team Empowerment, Levels of Planning Adaptation and much more.
Cover Agile development as you examine strong team building skills and effective planning and estimating.
Master the basics, principles, and practices of agile methods and frameworks of Scrum and Extreme Programming.

items.title: PMP Exam Cram Session - Updated for the 2021 PMP Exam

visible_instructors.name: Joseph
visible_instructors.job_title: PMP, PMI-ACP, Project+, ITIL, PSM I, CTT+
visible_instructors.title: Joseph Phillips

items.headline: PMP Essentials for PMBOK Guide Everything You Must Know to Pass the PMP Exam
objectives_summary: Final push to prepare to pass the PMP exam
Discuss complete coverage of all exam objectives
Everything you must know to pass the PMP

items.title: Project Management Fundamentals: Run projects effectively

visible_instructors.name: PracticalGrowth
visible_instructors.job_title: Practical, applicable courses for career growth
visible_instructors.title: PracticalGrowth

items.headline: Learn how to effectively analyze, plan, execute, and manage projects that consistently accomplish company objectives
objectives_summary: The role of a project manager and the skills you need to be successful
Defining, developing, and pitching an idea to get a project initiated
How to plan out and properly execute your project

items.title: Project Management Essentials
items.headline: A crash course in the essentials of project management for new project managers.
objectives_summary: What project management fundamentally does, and the domains it applies to.
The five stages of the formal project management process, their essential features, and how they fit together.
The most important concept in project management – the triple constraint, its key messages, and how they inter-relate.

items.title: Comparing Agile vs Waterfall Project Management
items.headline: Which Project Management method is best between Agile and Waterfall?
objectives_summary: All the pros and cons of Agile and Waterfall (PMP) methods
Learn from two world class experts
Learn which technique to use for your project

items.title: Agile PM 202 - Introduction to Agile Project Management

visible_instructors.name: Agile Project Management Academy -
visible_instructors.job_title: Author of The Project Manager's Guide to Mastering Agile
visible_instructors.display_name: Agile Project Management Academy - Chuck Cobb
visible_instructors.title: Agile Project Management Academy - Chuck Cobb

items.headline: Learn How to Apply Project Management Practices in an Agile Environment
objectives_summary: Develop an objective understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of both an Agile and traditional plan-driven approach to project management and how they can be combined in the right proportions to fit any given situation in an integrated approach to Agile Project Management
Learn what's fundamentally different about Agile Project Management and the shifts in thinking that project managers might need to make to operate successfully in an Agile environment
Better understand the impact of Agile on the project management profession, the new challenges that Agile creates for project managers, and the potential roles that an Agile Project Manager can play

items.title: Agile PM 102 - What Is The Future of  Agile Project Mgmt?

visible_instructors.name: Agile Project Management Academy -
visible_instructors.job_title: Author of The Project Manager's Guide to Mastering Agile
visible_instructors.display_name: Agile Project Management Academy - Chuck Cobb
visible_instructors.title: Agile Project Management Academy - Chuck Cobb

items.headline: Learn how to develop yourself into a high impact Agile Project Management role and reinvigorate your career!
objectives_summary: Understand the impact that Agile and Lean are having on the project management profession
Learn how to take advantage of the new career opportunities that Agile Project Management creates

items.title: Scrum and Agile Basics - Theory,  Certification Tips

visible_instructors.name: Paweł
visible_instructors.job_title: Agile Coach in DSV Global Transport and Logistics
visible_instructors.title: Paweł Kałkus

items.headline: Discover Scrum and agile principles, learn practical examples and prepare for the Scrum Master certification
objectives_summary: Understand the Scrum framework basics.
List all core Scrum elements (Roles, Artifacts, Events, Values) and explain their meaning.
Point out the differences between the agile and waterfall approaches.

items.title: Practical Project Management for Managers and First Time PMs

visible_instructors.name: Mike
visible_instructors.title: Mike Clayton
visible_instructors.job_title: Real World Trainer in Personal Effectiveness

items.headline: Learn Project management so you can deliver your next project be on time, on budget, and to requirements.
objectives_summary: Understand how projects work and be able to control your project process
Deploy some of the main ways to avoid budget and schedule over-runs
Define your project precisely, for your benefit and everyone else's

items.headline: Learn practical application of Project Management using Primavera P6 software, version 8.3 or above.
objectives_summary: Plan, monitor and control time, cost and resources of a project to achieve project goals.

items.title: Business Process Modeling A-Z™: Learn BPMN 2.0 From Scratch

Feel confident in writing user stories for any project
Understand what a Requirements Spec is and Why they are less flexible than a Product Backlog built with Agile User Stories
